meanings.definition: The quality of sharpness or clarity in an image.
meanings.sent1: The acutance of the photo made every detail stand out clearly.
meanings.sent2: Photographers strive to enhance the acutance of their images for better quality.
meanings.sent3: The acutance of the picture was so high that even the tiniest speck of dust was visible!
meanings.sent4: Her eyes had an acutance that seemed to pierce through your soul.
meanings.sent5: The acutance of the painting was so striking that it felt almost three-dimensional.

meanings.definition: The degree to which adjacent areas of an image are differentiated in terms of lightness and darkness.
meanings.sent1: The acutance of the photograph helped distinguish between light and dark areas.
meanings.sent2: In black and white photography, acutance plays a crucial role in defining contrast.
meanings.sent3: The acutance in the picture was so high that it almost looked like a puzzle of shadows and light.
meanings.sent4: The acutance of the scene created a dramatic play of shadows and highlights.
meanings.sent5: The acutance of the image was so clear that it felt like you could reach out and touch the textures.
